snippet: Gov. Jerry Brown on Friday commuted the sentence of a woman convicted in 1997 of shaking her baby grandson to death, saying significant doubts surrounded her conviction.
abstract: California Gov Jerry Brown commutes the sentence of Shirley Ree Smith, who was convicted in 1997 of shaking her baby grandson to death; Brown cites significant doubts surrounding Smith's conviction.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Jerry Brown on Friday commuted the sentence of a woman convicted in 1997 of shaking her baby grandson to death, saying significant doubts surrounded her conviction.
